## 1 - A new day, a new plot, a new geom


```{r Q1 data cleaning and new columns}
#| label: Q1 data cleaning and new columns
edibnb <- edibnb |>
  group_by(neighbourhood) |>
  mutate(med_review = median(review_scores_rating, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  ungroup() |>
  mutate(neighbourhood = fct_reorder(neighbourhood, med_review),
         #directed to documentation (https://forcats.tidyverse.org/reference/fct_reorder.html) through slack overflow
         
         neighbourhood = fct_explicit_na(neighbourhood, na_level = "Other/Unknown"))
        #attempted with replace_na() but unable to figure out why it didn't work. Consulted AI on why it didn't work and realized that neighbourhood was in the wrong class. Directed to fct_explicit_na and code written based off forcats documentation. (https://forcats.tidyverse.org/reference/fct_explicit_na.html)
  
edibnb
```
```{r}
edibnb |>
  ggplot(aes(x = review_scores_rating, y = neighbourhood)) +
  geom_density_ridges() +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(75, 105)) +
  theme_minimal()
```
